title: Fix poll_flush on closed connection
body:
Flushing when there is nothing to send anymore should succeed.

Relevant code in `tungstenite` crate code:
https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/blob/e5efe537b87a6705467043fe44bb220ddf7c1ce8/src/protocol/mod.rs#L390

title: Support IPv6 URIs with rustls
body:
When trying to connect to an IPv6 address with the `rustls` feature enabled, the connection fails because `rustls` parses the domain as an `std::net::IPAddr` which expects the IP to not have the square brackets around it e.g. `2001:db8:3333:4444:CCCC:DDDD:EEEE:FFFF` instead of `[2001:db8:3333:4444:CCCC:DDDD:EEEE:FFFF]`. But when providing/parsing an `http::URI` the square brackets are required. 

If we strip the square brackets from the host before passing it to `rustls` the connection works. 

#### Repro snippet:
```
tokio_tungstenite::connect_async("wss://[2001:db8:3333:4444:CCCC:DDDD:EEEE:FFFF]:443").await.expect("to connect");
```

title: Revert tokio requirement to 1.0.0
body: See [this comment](https://github.com/snapview/tokio-tungstenite/commit/aed9a089e16aa3bb149fb3f6c3101c200f41cea3#r109076924#r109076924). Updating this dependency breaks consumers of this crate unnecessarily.

title: Removed unused `webpki` dependency
body: It looks like the crate was never used directly, but only via the re-export by `tokio_rustls`.

title: Use re-exported tungstenite types so its easier to copy examples and …
body:
…not depend directly on tungstenite.

(I ran into the same confusion as in: https://github.com/snapview/tokio-tungstenite/issues/141)

title: Update dependencies and set rust-version
body:
Supported rust-version before this change was 1.63, so upgrading dependencies had no effect.

This is particularly useful since tungstenite has upgraded to 0.19, but a few more dependencies are coming along for the ride as well.

title: [refactor] connect.rs: extract duplicated code into a function
body: `connect_async_with_config` and `connect_async_tls_with_config` have identical implementations. `connector` parameter is the only difference.

title: create server-headers example
body: Example for read server headers without hyper crate

title: Improve CI build jobs
body: The Ubuntu images already come with docker and `cargo hack` is now installed with [`taiki-e/install-action`](https://github.com/taiki-e/install-action).

body:
```
Warning: the `merge_imports` option is deprecated. Use `imports_granularity="Crate"` instead
```

body: This resolves most deprecation warnings from the build jobs.

title: connect: disable Nagle algorithm
body: Fixes #250.

title: echo-server.rs - Correct usage documentation to refer to the correct …
body: …example  and add a note about how to use it.

title: Make handshake dependencies optional.
body:
This is the PR I promised in snapview/tungstenite-rs#296.
It requires snapview/tungstenite-rs#300 to be merged and released before we can release this.

This adds a cargo feature named `handshake` which is enabled by default. Disabling it removes the handshake feature of tungstenite.

title: Add an example of using tungstenite with a custom accept.
Make the semantics of `Stream` more reasonable
body: Closes https://github.com/snapview/tokio-tungstenite/issues/200.

title: Fix autobahn scripts
body: Same as https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/pull/272

title: Fix `poll_close` returning WouldBlock error kind
body:
Currently, `poll_close` is not checking for `io::ErrorKind::WouldBlock` on error, and instead it is bumbled up.
For instance, calling the [`close` helper from `SinkExt`](https://docs.rs/futures-util/latest/futures_util/sink/trait.SinkExt.html#method.close):
```rust
ws.close().await.unwrap();
```
will cause a panic when `WouldBlock` occurs, instead of simply polling as expected.

This patch addresses this by returning `Poll::Pending` and then polling `write_pending` to drive the close operation to completion.

title: Bump up dependency versions
body:
Simply bumping `tungstenite` to latest `0.17.1` and bumping `env_logger` as well, while we're already at it.

The motivation for this is to remove duplicate dependencies on `sha-1`.

title: Correct feature selection for connect_async_tls_with_config
body: The feature selection for `connect_async_tls_with_config` is incorrect so it will not be enabled if rustls is used, this patch fixes that issue.

title: Upgrade to rustls 0.20
body:
Upgrading to `rustls` version `0.20`, same as in https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/pull/244.

Marked as draft as it depends on `rustls-native-certs` and the mentioned PR for `tungstenite`.

title: Re-port #90
body:
This is essentially a re-port of #90 to the latest version of tokio-tungstenite - the PR has merge conflicts and I assume that's why it hasn't been touched at all. I'm hoping that this re-port will make it possible to apply the changes. I also removed the unused `async-await` feature on futures-util.

Would love to see this merged since most other libraries - e.g. async-tungstenite or hyper - moved away from pin-project and this allows for much faster compile times.

As mentioned in #90, this might be a breaking change, but I am not sure. It does work fine for my existing uses and the examples, however.

title: Fix the echo server example to prevent ConnectionClosed error
body:
Related #188

The echo server would generate ConnectionClosed error when the peer close the connection normally. 

This is because that `tungstenite` crate automatically reply Close message to the peer. 
Then `StreamExt::forward()` also forwards the Close message after the connection is closed.

title: Fail with TlsFeatureNotEnabled if connecting to wss without the feature
body: Fixes: #182

title: Reduce crate package size
body:
Same as in https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/pull/229, reducing crate package size to improve download speed for everyone.

Especially big reductions here due to the removal of autobahn JSON files from the package.

title: Allow choosing rustls certs through flags
body:
This aligns the feature flags with latest changes from `tungstenite-rs`. It allows to pick either native OS certs or the `webpki-roots` embedded certs (or both) to be used for rustls.

The PR is a draft as the latest changed from tungstenite are not published as new release yet.
﻿

title: Add a function to connect with a specific connector
body:
This makes reusing a tls connector much easier as you will not have to
set up the socket to connect on yourself. When using native-tls this
can save a considerable amount of memory.

title: Fix Autobahn Scripts
body:
See commit messages for more details.

**NOTE:** I also noticed that one of the files with results for Autobahn was [apparently blindly] copied in our repositories and is not used neither in `tungstenite-rs` nor in `tokio-tungstenite`. I tried to include this small clean up in this PR (could not hold myself leaving it as is), but I plan to submit a separate PR to do the same in `tungstenite-rs`. Additionally, there is a possibility to remove the code duplication for the tests that we do for Autobahn and to extract the common part, so that `tokio-tungstenite` and `tungstenite-rs` do not need to contain the same code.

title: Add documentation about TLS features to README
body: Because I was struggling with this and did not think about looking into the Cargo.toml for the features, I would like to add a few lines to the README describing the features required for TLS support.

title: Enable `native-tls` and `rustls-tls` features on docs.rs
body: Current documentation is missing the types and functions for tls.

title: Use 127.0.0.1 in tests to avoid firewall warnings
body:
As the title says, this changes all tests to run on 127.0.0.1 instead of 0.0.0.0.

When for example on MacOS you get a firewall warning for every time the code changes and the tests are run as the binary changed. Some firewalls even let the tests hang so they have to be cancelled and restarted several times.

By changing to 127.0.0.1 this warnings don't come as the binary won't listen for requests from external devices.

title: Fix "no-default-features" build failure
body:
Fixes #154.

~It's not ready to merge: The error isn't fixed yet, because I first want to see if the newly added check is effective.~

title: Add support for rustls as TLS backend, update tungstenite version
body:
This adds support for `rustls` as TLS backend. It depends on `tungstenite-rs` 0.13.

Naming is exactly the same as in tungstenite and I added a missing feature for vendoring as well as it only existed in tungstenite so far: `native-tls-vendored`.

Fixes #127.

title: Upgrade to tokio 1.0
body:
Tokio 1.0 has just been [released](https://github.com/tokio-rs/tokio/releases/tag/tokio-1.0.0) and PR updates to the latest release.

This depends on:
- [x] https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/pull/163 to be merged first which upgrades `tungstenite` to use bytes to 1.0.
- [x] https://github.com/tokio-rs/tls to be released first which upgrades `tokio-native-tls` to use tokio 1.0.

I will update this PR as the dependencies become ready.

Currently waiting on new release of the following crates to mark this PR as ready:
- [x] [input_buffer](https://github.com/snapview/input_buffer)
- [x] [tungstenite](https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs)

title: Regular maintenance + wanted to check how the new GitHub actions would work :P
Migrate to GitHub Actions
body:
The PR adds an optimized GitHub Actions workflow and splits the original build job into two jobs, one for the basic tests and another for the Autobahn Testsuite.

see https://github.com/nickelc/tokio-tungstenite/actions/runs/304339616

title: Add the option to configure the TLS connection.
body:
This PR addresses #111. 

Instead of exposing a `danger_client_async_tls` function, I've decided to add the option to pass a `TlsConnector` to `client_async_tls_with_config` (which will enable people to add root certificates to the connector, or disable certificate validation altogether).

I'm happy to some up with a different solution if you disagree with this change.

title: Switch to tokio-native-tls crate
body: Closes: #106

title: Update `tungstenite` to 0.11
body:
Fixes #108
Changes between 0.10 and 0.11: https://github.com/snapview/tungstenite-rs/compare/v0.10.1...v0.11.0
It seems we don't have to tweak code here.

title: Remove uses of pin_project::project attribute
body:
pin-project will deprecate the project attribute due to some unfixable
limitations.

Refs: https://github.com/taiki-e/pin-project/issues/225

*Although the deprecation of the project attribute has not been released yet, this PR is submitted in advance to avoid the CI from being broken by deprecated warnings.*

title: Add option to configure the websocket
body:
I'm fetching > 16mb over a websocket and don't have the ability to set a higher limit.

This PR fixes the issue.

title: Forward handshake errors directly instead of wrapping them in a Other…
body:
… IO error

This allows getting HTTP status codes back to the caller, for example,
and allows proper handling of handshake errors.

Fixes https://github.com/snapview/tokio-tungstenite/issues/97

title: Derive `Debug` for `WebSocketStream<S>` and fix some warnings
Feature/expose config from tungstenite.
body: Follow up from snapview/tungstenite-rs#112. Will only work once new version of tungstenite is released.

title: build(deps): minimize unnecessary dependencies by using `futures-{channel,util}` directly instead of `futures`
Fix clippy warning about ok_or() followed by a function call
body:
warning: use of `ok_or` followed by a function call
       --> src/connect.rs:132:10
        |
    132 |         .ok_or(Error::Url("Url scheme not supported".into()))?;
        |          ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ help: try this: `ok_or_else(|| Error::Url("Url scheme not supported".into()))`
